scenarioDescription:
The K2-154 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-154 is a star with 0.65 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.63 times its radius. It is located 421.90 light years away from the solar system.

K2-154 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-154 system


K2-154 b

K2-154 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-154 b is 4.611 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-154 b is 1.990 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.22, and a semi-major axis of 0.0405 astronomical units, K2-154 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.


K2-154 c

K2-154 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-154 c is 4.929 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-154 c is 2.070 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.06, and a semi-major axis of 0.0677 astronomical units, K2-154 c could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-154, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-154 - System With 2 Exolanets
